channel.title: Rwt
channel.description:
So you can now buy spins for the squeal of fortune...
[img]http://img88.imageshack.us/img88/2627/extraspins.jpg[/img]
Under Honor section of the Runescape rules
Real world trading - "Game items must only be exchanged for other items/services within the game."
Need I say anymore?

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

I would say the chances or receiving a rare item are about the same as they were before tbh. Like earlier there was only one cabbage in the prizes and I won it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman

@m1lkman wrote:

Acorn_:

Not only that but I’ve also heard that since this update the chances of actually receiving a rare item have decreased slightly.

that pisses me off.

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

It really is sad to see once such an enjoy full game turn into something uninteresting and money prioritized.
With this new update it’s obvious that they’re losing players fast and are trying to compensate for the money loss.
Not only that but I’ve also heard that since this update the chances of actually receiving a rare item have decreased slightly.

Read full topic

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:72, topic:438205”][quote author=Mitko link=topic=540924.msg3964123#msg3964123 date=1333555850]
I don’t see why you’re all complaining, so they’re in need of money, big deal. This does not affect anything on the game, you can still kill your bosses, train your skills and make your money, how does one quit because of this?
[/quote]

Let’s say someone hacks your account. Oops, there goes your RS Bank along with your IRL Bank. They don’t require a pin or anything to buy Spins, and you can buy as many as you want, so they can just sit there and buy thousands of spins, then you get to sit there and call your Bank and explain to them what happened.[/quote]

This has apparently been fixed, though.

Read full topic

They don’t require a pin or anything to buy Spins, and you can buy as many as you want, so they can just sit there and buy thousands of spins, then you get to sit there and call your Bank and explain to them what happened.

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:61, topic:438205”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=540924.msg3962083#msg3962083 date=1333390838]

You know it’s funny though we discuss how stupid Jagex is yet nobody has mentioned how much Jagex has probably already made from this.

What about how much they have lost? I guarantee thousands of people have cancelled their recurring subscriptions.
[/quote]people say that but highly doubtful. I read a post somewhere a while back after the “death of the wilderness in 07” jagex only lost about 10-15% of their base in reality. You have to also consider how many accounts are “secondary” accounts[/quote]

Only? 10-15% is a massive loss of profits. Companies don’t run on 50% profit margins, man. They run on much smaller margins, smaller than that 10-15% loss. Jagex has been taking a hit since removing the Wild. They got a bit back after bringing back free trade, but they ended up losing many more people due to quitting from the bot outbreak and banning many of the bot members accounts.

Read full topic

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:55, topic:438205”]In the past Jagex has said that they would like to control the RWT. I believe there was something about it in the removal of free trade and wilderness announcement. How much money will be lost from the gold companies?

[quote]Taking into account how serious this issue is and knowing that reactive methods could never completely stop real-world trading, what are the proactive solutions? Well, considering how much money is involved, one solution would have been to allow real-world trading. Why not just let players sell their RuneScape gold and items and take a small cut of the profits ourselves? “We’ve seen other MMOGs take that route and it works, but only to a limited extent. Some players would sell gold through their own website to avoid paying the developer a cut. Worse than that, the demand for gold was still mostly being met by players using bots and scams, ruining the experience for legitimate players,” says Mod Chris81.
Mod Hobagoly says, “It would be very difficult to find a way of allowing players to buy RuneScape items for real money that doesn’t cheapen the game.” There might be some way of doing this, and without all the negatives, but it wasn’t the right solution for ridding RuneScape of real-world traders and bots. Andrew follows with, “We looked at any number of different possible solutions. We’ve read independent studies and spoken with other people in the MMOG industry. Ultimately, the consensus is that the only way to remove the real-world trading market is to develop your game so you cannot make unbalanced trades.”[/quote]

Read More: http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Update:Diary_-_RuneScape_vs._Real-world_Trading#Removing_unbalanced_trade

This might possibly be a good thing. It puts more money in Jagex’s pocket rather than faggot ass gold sellers’s.[/quote]

Not really. If somebody has RWT before then they most likely want something in particular. Why risk wasting your money when you could just buy they amount you need from gold sellers? The only thing this will do is give people who don’t RWT a way in which to do so without risking a ban.

Read full topic

item.title: Rwt
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

In the past Jagex has said that they would like to control the RWT. I believe there was something about it in the removal of free trade and wilderness announcement. How much money will be lost from the gold companies?

Taking into account how serious this issue is and knowing that reactive methods could never completely stop real-world trading, what are the proactive solutions? Well, considering how much money is involved, one solution would have been to allow real-world trading. Why not just let players sell their RuneScape gold and items and take a small cut of the profits ourselves? "We've seen other MMOGs take that route and it works, but only to a limited extent. Some players would sell gold through their own website to avoid paying the developer a cut. Worse than that, the demand for gold was still mostly being met by players using bots and scams, ruining the experience for legitimate players," says Mod Chris81. Mod Hobagoly says, "It would be very difficult to find a way of allowing players to buy RuneScape items for real money that doesn't cheapen the game." There might be some way of doing this, and without all the negatives, but it wasn't the right solution for ridding RuneScape of real-world traders and bots. Andrew follows with, "We looked at any number of different possible solutions. We've read independent studies and spoken with other people in the MMOG industry. Ultimately, the consensus is that the only way to remove the real-world trading market is to develop your game so you cannot make unbalanced trades."

Read More: http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Update:Diary_-_RuneScape_vs._Real-world_Trading#Removing_unbalanced_trade

This might possibly be a good thing. It puts more money in Jagex’s pocket rather than faggot ass gold sellers’s.

Read full topic
